topic: Uncovering the heart of my Nana’s saltwater stories

ideas.title: The Great St Kilda Pier Crab Conspiracy
ideas.premise: Nana's saltwater stories reveal a secret society of St Kilda Pier crabs plotting to overthrow the penguin colony.
ideas.why_funny: Absurd scenario; local Melbourne landmark; plays on the 'secret society' trope.

ideas.title: Nanna's Salty Tales: The Seagull Mafia
ideas.premise: Nana's stories expose a ruthless seagull mafia controlling all the chip supplies at Brighton Beach.
ideas.why_funny: Relatable annoyance (seagulls stealing chips) elevated to mafia level.

ideas.title: The Yarra River Monster: Truth or Tale?
ideas.premise: Nana claims the Yarra River Monster is real, and it only eats dropped souvlaki from Federation Square.
ideas.why_funny: Yarra River is notoriously dirty; monster with specific, funny diet.

ideas.title: The Salty Secret of the MCG
ideas.premise: Nana reveals the secret ingredient in the MCG's famous Four'N Twenty pies is seawater.
ideas.why_funny: Gross-out humor; beloved Melbourne institution tainted with saltwater.

ideas.title: Bogan Baywatch
ideas.premise: Nana's saltwater stories inspire a parody of Baywatch, set on a rough Melbourne beach, starring bogans.
ideas.why_funny: Juxtaposition of glamorous Baywatch with rough Aussie beach culture.

ranking: The Great St Kilda Pier Crab Conspiracy
Nanna's Salty Tales: The Seagull Mafia
The Yarra River Monster: Truth or Tale?
The Salty Secret of the MCG
winner: The Great St Kilda Pier Crab Conspiracy
